title: What champion should a noob like me get?
body: Yes, I have no idea what champion I shall main. Or get. TELL MEEEEE

replies.body:
Depends on your playstyle

Do you like champion with hard cc, good mobility, can make flashy plays etc.

Fizz is good, reliable, hard to kill and fairly easy to play, talon isn't too complicated either, for midlane. Tristana is a flashy assassin adc, master yi is kind of a hyper carry assassn and he's not too mechanically demanding.

oh for jungle then. Well then I'd suggest rengar, evelynn, nocturne and full ap malphite (malphite is not supposed to be an assassin but if you build ap, you end up being the most faceroll assassin champion and you're still pretty useful, it's not as hard as it sounds, basically try to focus on farming till 6, maxing r>e>q>w and then devestate people with ult, runic echos spam every button, it's not much outplay but it's really easy and ridiculously effective in lower elo).

Shaco is also really fun but he's hard to use since alot of his power comes from mindgames and flexibility despite having a super simple kit. Also ad shaco is easier and more reliable, whereas ap shaco is much more complicated and isn't as strong before 1st item but ends up being better lategame.

Ap/Ad shaco hurts a lot at the end of the day. Playing full ad/crit shaco + the power of your passive can 1 shot a adc with just 1 basic attack while ap shaco can 1 shot literally anyone with e and your boxes hurt too. Ap malphite is so cancer in low elo, no one knows how to counter him and it's so funny.
play a champ that wrecks people and get called a noob :D

As someone who also possess the mechanics of a potato; I will advise my top picks, low skill carry suggestions since some easy champs are bad for carrying:

**Top**: {{champion:14}} , {{champion:122}}  and {{champion:86}},   these are all very tanky and sion brings alot to a teamfight and can carry through tankiness, peel and cc and are very safe in lane. The last two are extremely strong duelists, better for winning lane hard and snowballing/spinning to victory.

**Mid**:  {{champion:1}}  and {{champion:105}}  (that's supposed to be Fizz). These champions are easy but powerful, Annie has better teamfight and is an immobile mage with lots of cc whereas fizz has extreme mobility, assassination potential even when behind and a mini-zhonias making him very hard to beat in lane.

**Jungle**: {{champion:19}}, {{champion:32}}  and {{champion:54}}. These champions all offer good lockdown and easy reliable ganks, especially post 6. Warwick is the first one, being one of the simplest champions in the game, he is also one of the few junglers capable of doing a full clear without runes or a leash though it helps significantly. Warwick is bad at ganking without his ult, but when you do have it up, it's generally guaranteed to make a successful gank. Ammumu offers alot of cc to the team but does rely on landing his q, he's extremely useful to the team and he has decent early ganks with it. Malphite is probably the best option and should be built tanky. Your ult does massive base damage and is a great gapclose and cc and you're jungle sustain is decent if you manage his rock shield passive. A good malphite ult can easily turn almost any teamfight.

**ADC**: {{champion:22}} and {{champion:21}}. Before I start this, if you want to go adc, make sure you can cs okay (averaging at least 60-70 at 10min) . Ashe is great lategame but has a strong laning phase and lots of cc, she's immobile so you'll need to be careful when positioning but her dueling power as an adc is pretty high and her slow makes kiting a little easier (use her w to slow and kite, using her passive slow is much harder since it's not as strong). Miss Fortune is a strong lane bully and shouldn't lose early trades, she's mechanically pretty simple and lategame most of what you have to do in a teamfight is position well and ult and a good support should be able to peel for that even in low elo. She doesn't need to focus on kiting like alot of other adcs since most her damage comes from abilities like a caster but she get's alot of move speed and atk speed from her strut so it's also pretty easy to do. Mf is very strong atm and works well with supports like blitzcrank, thresh, zyra and karma.

**Support**: {{champion:53}} {{champion:16}} and {{champion:37}}.  Blitzcrank is an easy champion to master with only 1 skillshot and the rest of his combo being pretty straight forward but if you can land your pulls, bot lane will be pretty easy, he does have mana issues so make sure to make your pulls count and not just fire them out randomly though. Soraka is also pretty simple, just watch out for positioning. Soraka is a strong lane bully early game with her q and e allowing her to bully and out-trade most bot laners before they get their damage spikes. Sona also does alot of damage and should stand back somewhat as well harassing with her q-aa combo and sustaining her adc through shields and healing. Later on her speed buff is extremely useful, her aura's are great in fights and her poke is extremely strong with lichbane and ludens echo procs, her ult is also a gamechanging ability doing decent damage and offering an extremely long aoe stun effect.

it all depends on your preferred position

do you enjoy top,bot,supp,mid or jungle the most?

Amumu is very easy to use in jg, I generally build him tank and rely on landing my Q into the pack and ult as many of them as I can. Either to initiate the fight, or try control the fight when it has been initiated. Flash ult can work if you miss your Q, but burning your flash is always risky business.

Also fiddlesticks, if played right, can be an amazing jungler. He has 100% sustain in jg with his drain, and powerful abilities for initiation, poke or peel. Landing his ult at the correct position and time is very crucial for maximum damage, along with focusing your other abilities while ulting. Zhonyas is a pretty key item to carry as your ult continues while you're invulnerable. Squishy champ though, so positioning is always crucial

Darius, he is quite OP, and he is very easy to use.
Irelia, she is quite easy to use.
